extent_I.clamp_location: Proximal: distal arch or proximal descending. Distal: suprarenal

extent_II.includes: Entire descending thoracic AND abdominal aorta
extent_II.visceral_involvement: All visceral vessels require reconstruction (celiac, SMA, renal arteries)
extent_II.clamp_location: Proximal: distal arch. Distal: iliac arteries
key_considerations: Longest clamp time and visceral ischemia
All adjuncts mandatory: CSF drain, LHB, cooling

extent_III.includes: Distal half of descending thoracic + all abdominal aorta
extent_III.clamp_location: Proximal: mid-descending thoracic. Distal: iliac arteries
key_considerations: Less thoracic aorta than Extent II

extent_IV.includes: Entire abdominal aorta from diaphragm to bifurcation
key_considerations: Essentially a suprarenal AAA with celiac involvement
Lowest spinal cord risk due to minimal thoracic involvement
May be amenable to fenestrated/branched EVAR

extent_V.name: Safi Modification
extent_V.includes: Distal thoracic aorta, stops above visceral segment
extent_V.visceral_involvement: None or minimal (does not extend to visceral vessels)
key_considerations: Added by Safi et al. to capture short-segment thoracoabdominal aneurysms
Lower morbidity than Extent II/III due to limited visceral involvement

surgical_planning_by_extent.extent_I_II: Mandatory adjuncts: CSF drainage, left heart bypass, reattach critical intercostals (T8-L2), staged repair (Elephant Trunk) consideration
surgical_planning_by_extent.extent_III: CSF drainage, visceral reconstruction, consider distal perfusion
surgical_planning_by_extent.extent_IV: Similar to juxtarenal/pararenal AAA, may use F/B-EVAR if favorable

spinal_cord_protection.critical_zone: T8-L2 (location of artery of Adamkiewicz in 75% of patients)
strategies: Left heart bypass for distal perfusion

prefLabel.@value: Crawford Classification of Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysms

definition.@value: Classification system dividing thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysms into five extents based on proximal and distal boundaries, used to predict surgical complexity and spinal cord ischemia risk

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Classify TAAAs by Crawford extent using anatomic boundaries
Correlate Crawford extent with spinal cord ischemia risk
Understand visceral reconstruction requirements by extent
Apply the Safi modification (Extent V) appropriately
Describe spinal cord protection strategies for high-risk extents
clinical_pearls: Extent II has the highest morbidity/mortality due to complete aortic replacement
T8-L2 is the critical zone - this is where the artery of Adamkiewicz originates in 75%
Staged Elephant Trunk repair reduces spinal cord ischemia in Extent II by allowing collateralization
CSF drainage reduces paraplegia risk by approximately 50%
Extent IV is essentially a suprarenal AAA - may be treatable with fenestrated EVAR
